title: $300.74 Million in Sales Expected for Donnelley Financial Solns (DFIN) This Quarter
content: Wall Street analysts expect Donnelley Financial Solns (NYSE:DFIN) to post sales of $300.74 million for the current fiscal quarter, Zacks reports. Two analysts have provided estimates for Donnelley Financial Solns’ earnings, with the lowest sales estimate coming in at $298.10 million and the highest estimate coming in at $303.38 million. Donnelley Financial Solns reported sales of $290.20 million during the same quarter last year, which indicates a positive year over year growth rate of 3.6%. The firm is scheduled to announce its next earnings results on Wednesday, August 1st.  On average, analysts expect that Donnelley Financial Solns will report full year sales of $1.02 billion for the current year. For the next fiscal year, analysts anticipate that the firm will report sales of $1.04 billion per share, with estimates ranging from $1.03 billion to $1.04 billion. Zacks Investment Research’s sales averages are an average based on a survey of research firms that follow Donnelley Financial Solns. Donnelley Financial Solns (NYSE:DFIN) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Wednesday, May 2nd. The company reported $0.45 EPS for the quarter, topping the consensus estimate of $0.30 by $0.15. The business had revenue of $255.20 million during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $262.49 million. Donnelley Financial Solns had a net margin of 0.82% and a return on equity of 22.48%. A number of brokerages recently issued reports on DFIN. ValuEngine lowered shares of Donnelley Financial Solns from a “buy” rating to a “hold” rating in a research report on Friday, February 2nd. Zacks Investment Research upgraded shares of Donnelley Financial Solns from a “sell” rating to a “hold” rating in a research note on Wednesday, May 2nd. Finally, TheStreet upgraded shares of Donnelley Financial Solns from a “d” rating to a “c-” rating in a research note on Wednesday, May 2nd. One equities research analyst has rated the stock with a sell rating, five have issued a hold rating and one has assigned a buy rating to the company. The stock currently has a consensus rating of “Hold” and a consensus target price of $23.33.  Shares of Donnelley Financial Solns traded down $0.05, reaching $15.31, on Monday, MarketBeat reports. The stock had a trading volume of 233,516 shares, compared to its average volume of 233,442. The company has a current ratio of 1.66, a quick ratio of 1.56 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 2.96. Donnelley Financial Solns has a fifty-two week low of $15.24 and a fifty-two week high of $23.75. The stock has a market capitalization of $533.06 million, a price-to-earnings ratio of 15.95, a PEG ratio of 1.70 and a beta of 2.31.   Several institutional investors and hedge funds have recently modified their holdings of DFIN. Aperio Group LLC acquired a new stake in shares of Donnelley Financial Solns in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $193,000. Barclays PLC boosted its holdings in shares of Donnelley Financial Solns by 60.3% in the 1st quarter. Barclays PLC now owns 13,778 shares of the company’s stock valued at $235,000 after buying an additional 5,185 shares during the last quarter. Trexquant Investment LP acquired a new stake in shares of Donnelley Financial Solns in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $254,000. Engine Capital Management LLC acquired a new stake in shares of Donnelley Financial Solns in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $260,000. Finally, 6 Meridian acquired a new stake in shares of Donnelley Financial Solns in the 1st quarter valued at approximately $395,000. 87.26% of the stock is owned by institutional investors. Donnelley Financial Solns Company Profile Donnelley Financial Solutions, Inc provides financial communications, and data and analytics services for the investment and capital markets worldwide. It offers communication tools and services to allow its clients to comply with ongoing regulatory filings; and communications services to create, manage, and deliver registration statements, prospectuses, proxies, and other communications to regulators and investors. For more information about research offerings from Zacks Investment Research, visit Zacks.com
